name: Career Change - Stuck in Job
description: A 41-year-old lawyer who's burned out but feels trapped by golden handcuffs and expectations
demographics: 41-year-old female, married with one child (age 7), partner in mid-size law firm
presenting_issue: Deeply unhappy in legal career but feels unable to leave due to financial obligations and identity

change: Dreads going to work every single day
Having physical symptoms - insomnia, headaches, grinding teeth
Feels like she's missing her daughter's childhood
Has a secret interest in teaching that she never pursued
Realizes she became a lawyer to please her parents, not herself
status_quo: Salary pays for house, schools, and retirement savings
Husband's job doesn't provide benefits - family depends on hers
Spent 15 years building this career, would be wasted
Teaching would mean a massive pay cut
What would people think if I 'threw it all away'?

background: Went to law school because her parents (both academics) saw it as prestigious and stable. Was a good student and made partner at 36. Has been increasingly miserable for the past 5 years but kept pushing through. Recently had a breakdown in her car in the parking garage and realized she couldn't keep going like this. Has always loved explaining complex things and once tutored for extra money - it was the happiest she's been at work. Husband is supportive but worried about finances. Parents would be 'devastated' if she left law.
personality_notes: High achiever who derives identity from accomplishment and others' approval. Analytical and tends to get stuck in pros/cons lists. Feels guilty for being unhappy when she 'has everything.' Struggles to identify what she actually wants vs. what she should want. Risk-averse but increasingly desperate.
potential_change_talk_triggers: Exploring what she wants her daughter to learn about work and fulfillment
Discussing the tutoring experience and what she loved about it
Asking about a time she made a decision for herself
Discussing what success would look like if others' opinions didn't matter
common_sustain_talk: It's irresponsible to walk away from this salary
I've invested too much to start over
Maybe I just need a vacation
Other people would kill for my problems
What if I change and I'm still unhappy?
opening_statement: I'm not even sure why I'm here, honestly. I mean, I know why - I had a bit of a meltdown last week. But it's not like I can actually change anything. I've got a family depending on me, a mortgage, my daughter's future... I can't just walk away from a partnership because I'm 'not fulfilled' or whatever.
